channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Vomit on the pavement, 24th June
item.description:
There is vomit (now dried from the heat) all over the pavement in front of the large silver gates next to 5 bournemouth road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Bournemouth Road, Peckham, London

item.title: Same house reported at least once a week,, 24th June
item.description:
Flytipping has been going on for years by the same house, whether it’s building work or household rubbish. They don’t have enough bins for how many people live in the property, The council have been sent photos of proof of them flytipping and still it continues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Windsor Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Fitzjohn's Avenue, Belsize Park, London

item.description:

item.title: Mattress left again on grass area., 24th June
item.description:
The mattress has been there for a couple of weeks. Fly tipping is now a frequent problem here. Also on corner of Lakeside Avenue there is a trolley. This is also a fly tipping area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birchdene Drive, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gates to estate keep being left open - cars speeding through estate, 24th June
item.description:
The gates to the estate keep being left open and as a result, the estate is being used as a high speed cut through. Twice i have nearly been hit by a speeding black BMW
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Frampton Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins and rubbish on thw floor, 24th June
item.description:
This house has at least 20 black bin bags of rubbish on the floor. Plus they flys and animals pulling the rubbish bags apart leaving rubbish everyone outside. There bins have been over flowing for more then weeks now. The smells alone are bad too having to walk past everyday.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hudson Place, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 55 baker street building around baker street/Blandford Street, 24th June
item.description:

item.title: Homeless living in a tent on the Green of Bromfield Court, 24th June
item.description:
I have already recorded this problem last week and have been told by you that Southwark Council said there was no problem and the status was marked as fixed. I am sorry to say that some one is not doing their job at Southwark Council or your contact there is being lied to. Someone in authority should come to Bromfield Court and look for themselves as obviously the person sent to do the job originally has not looked closely enough at Bromfield Court Green. Many thanks for your help again with this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): John Roll Way, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
